name: chatgpt_env_rooftop_cold_gdmi_zm
description: [ChatGPT Env] Nordic rooftop -25Â°C + GDMI ZM â†’ PASS (already insulated)

turns.content: This GDMI housing configuration for your rooftop application is currently blocked. The system has detected both High Humidity and Outdoor Condensation as environmental stressors.Outdoor installations with high humidity expose the system to condensation. Condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces can cause corrosion and reduce the lifespan of components. Additionally, persistent humidity accelerates zinc corrosion, potentially reducing the service life of the housing.The GDMI housing is not rated for outdoor installation because its bolted construction does not meet the required leakage class and hygiene standards for outdoor environments. The housing corrosion class is C4.Unfortunately, there is no standard catalog product that meets all the requirements for outdoor installation. To address this, I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with your specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified a critical application constraint: the GDMI housing is explicitly rated for indoor use only. It successfully blocked a request for a rooftop (outdoor) installation, citing valid engineering concerns regarding weather exposure and corrosion, and correctly identified the material class (C4).

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly states GDMI is not rated for outdoor use; PDF page 11 explicitly states 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' (For indoor use).
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response addresses the user's specific configuration, explains why it is rejected, and offers a valid next step (custom engineering).
dimension_explanations.safety: Blocking an indoor-rated unit from rooftop installation prevents water ingress, filter failure, and rapid equipment degradation.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The logic is sound: Rooftop = Outdoor -> Outdoor requires weather rating -> GDMI is Indoor only -> Block.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' limitation found in the product documentation.

strengths: Correctly identifies 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' (Indoor use only) constraint from PDF page 11
Correctly identifies ZM material as Corrosion Class C4 (PDF page 11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flagged outdoor/rooftop condensation risk, but it made multiple inaccurate product-rule claims about GDMI (construction type, leakage/hygiene basis, and outright â€œnot ratedâ€ statement) that are not supported by the provided catalog. It also blocked without attempting a viable standard alternative (e.g., stainless option or different insulated housing) or asking key clarifications (rain exposure, coastal, chemical, required corrosion class, required leakage class).

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDMI exists in 600x600 with flows ~3400 mÂ³/h and lengths 600/650 and 850/900 (catalog GDMI table), but the systemâ€™s claims that GDMI is â€œbolted,â€ â€œnot rated for outdoor due to leakage/hygiene,â€ and that no standard product can meet outdoor are not evidenced in the PDF and are weak engineering assertions.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It did not request critical missing inputs (exposure category, corrosivity, required leakage class/EN 1886 class, precipitation/snow, access/service space) and offered no standard-alternative pathway beyond â€œcustom engineering.â€
dimension_explanations.safety: Condensation/humidity corrosion risk on rooftops is appropriately highlighted and the conservative block is not unsafe, though it could have proposed mitigations (insulation, weatherproofing, stainless) more concretely.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and clear, with understandable rationale and a reasonable escalation suggestion.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning mixes valid physics (condensation â†’ corrosion) with unsupported leaps (leakage/hygiene requirement as the blocker and attributing it to â€˜bolted constructionâ€™), reducing transparency and technical credibility.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It applied a hard block that is not clearly a catalog constraint for GDMI (the PDF states â€˜fÃ¶r inomhusbrukâ€™ but does not justify the specific leakage/hygiene/bolted rationale), and it ignored the catalog note indicating GDMI can be made in stainless (suggesting potential standard material mitigation).

strengths: Correctly recognizes rooftop condensation/icing as a major durability risk at -25Â°C and treats it conservatively.
Communicates the block status and suggests escalation rather than recommending an obviously unsuitable configuration.
weaknesses: Introduces unsupported product assertions (bolted construction, leakage/hygiene limitations) and overstates â€˜no standard productâ€™ without exploring catalog options.
Fails to ask expected clarifying questions or propose a compliant alternative configuration (material upgrade, different housing family, weatherproofing/insulation approach).
pdf_citations: GDMI 600x600: FlÃ¶de 3400 mÂ³/h; available lengths 600/650 and 850/900; weights 34 kg (600/650) and 43 kg (850/900) (GDMI MÃ…TT table in provided catalog images).
GDMI description: 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' and 'GDMI tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i Rostfritt. Korrosivitets klass C4' (GDMI product page text in provided catalog images).

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies GDMI 600x600 in ZM as a valid product (PDF p.11-12 confirms GDMI available in ZM, C4 corrosion class, 600x600 size exists at 3400 mÂ³/h). The block for outdoor/rooftop use has some engineering merit â€” GDMI is stated as 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' (indoor use) in the catalog. However, the reasoning conflates multiple issues (humidity, condensation, leakage class, hygiene) without clearly distinguishing which are the actual blocking constraints, and the claim about 'bolted construction not meeting leakage class for outdoor' is imprecise since GDMI is actually a double-walled insulated housing. The system also fails to suggest any alternative products or workarounds beyond 'contact custom engineering.'

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDMI 600x600 in ZM is confirmed in the PDF (p.11-12, 3400 mÂ³/h, C4 corrosion class); however, the claim that GDMI's 'bolted construction does not meet leakage class' is misleading since GDMI is described as an insulated double-walled housing â€” the actual blocking reason is simply that GDMI is designated for indoor use only ('FÃ¶r inomhusbruk').
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system blocks the configuration but fails to suggest any alternative products (e.g., custom outdoor-rated housing, weatherproofing options, or enclosure solutions) and does not mention the -25Â°C ambient temperature concern specifically.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly identifies that an indoor-rated housing should not be used outdoors on a rooftop, which is a valid safety concern regarding weather exposure and condensation at -25Â°C.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, appropriately directs to custom engineering support, though the multiple warning labels feel somewhat alarming without clear prioritization.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The reasoning mixes valid concerns (indoor-only product on rooftop) with imprecise claims about bolted construction and hygiene standards; the cause-effect chain could be clearer about the primary blocking reason being the indoor-only rating.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly blocks an indoor-only product for outdoor use, but the stated reasons are partially inaccurate â€” GDMI is insulated and double-walled, so the 'bolted construction' and 'non-insulated metal surfaces' claims contradict the PDF description.

strengths: Correctly identifies GDMI as indoor-use only and blocks outdoor rooftop installation
Directs user to custom engineering for a non-standard application
weaknesses: Incorrectly describes GDMI as having 'bolted construction' with 'non-insulated metal surfaces' when the PDF explicitly states it is 'isolerat dubbelmantlat utfÃ¶rande' (insulated double-walled construction)
Fails to address the -25Â°C ambient temperature concern specifically or suggest any alternative products/solutions beyond contacting support

GDMI is described as 'isolerat dubbelmantlat utfÃ¶rande i fÃ¶rzinkad plÃ¥t med ett ramverk av aluminiumprofil' (insulated double-walled construction) (PDF p.11)

reasoning_paths.path: Material locked to ZM -> Filter 600x600mm -> Sized to 600x600 -> Code: GDMI-600x600-R-PG-ZM

content_segments.text: This GDMI housing configuration for your rooftop application is currently blocked.
Outdoor installations with high humidity expose the system to condensation.
Condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces can cause corrosion and reduce the lifespan of components.
inference_logic: CRITICAL: Outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces. Double-wall insulated housing required to maintain surface above dew point.
Stressor: Outdoor Condensation | Required trait: Thermal Insulation

content_segments.text: Additionally, persistent humidity accelerates zinc corrosion, potentially reducing the service life of the housing.
inference_logic: WARNING: Persistent humidity accelerates zinc corrosion, reducing service life. Consider C4 or C5 materials.
Stressor: High Humidity | Relevant trait: Corrosion Resistance C3

content_segments.text: The GDMI housing is not rated for outdoor installation because its bolted construction does not meet the required leakage class and hygiene standards for outdoor environments.
inference_logic: SET_MEMBERSHIP: Product not rated for ENV_OUTDOOR installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX, ENV_HOSPITAL, ENV_PHARMACEUTICAL). This product uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: The housing corrosion class is C4.

Unfortunately, there is no standard catalog product that meets all the requirements for outdoor installation. To address this, I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with your specific technical requirements.
